email.description: Email for author of the module.

module_template_version.description: Version of the template the module was built from.

narrator.description: LiaScript default voice narrator of the module.

comment.description: This is a short, focused description of the module.

long_description.description: This is a longer description, which should be understandable for a lay audience. It will print under "Is this module right for me?" in the overview.

estimated_time.description: This is rough guess of how long it might take a learner to work through the module. It will print under "Estimated time to completion" in the overview

@learning_objectives.description:
After completion of this module, learners will be able to: 
- identify key elements 
- create a product 
- do a task 
- articulate the rationale for something.

@pre_reqs.description:
List any skills and knowledge needed to do this module here. When available, include links to resources, especially other modules we've made (to show learners where this falls within our catalog). 
- one skill we have [another module for, linked here](https://education.arcus.chop.edu) 
- some familiarity with [a topic](https://education.arcus.chop.edu) 
- * understanding of [one thing](https://education.arcus.chop.edu) and [another](https://education.arcus.chop.edu) 
- If relevant, you can include recommendations for somewhere else to start if the learner doesn't have these prereqs. For example: If you are brand new to R or python (or want a refresher) consider starting with [Intro to R](link) or [Intro to python](link) first and then coming back here.

good_first_module.description: True or false value for whether the module would be a good first start for a beginner. Need definition for what constitutes a good first module.

data_domain.description: Optional metadata for modules that focus on a particular type of data, either as the topic of the module or as the main type of examples.

data_task.description: Optional metadata. What type of task/action/skill does this module teach?

coding.description: True/False based on whether achieving the module's learning objectives requires coding. This includes a user running code locally or interacting with code in the module.

coding_required.description: The coding level required for the module as a whole.

coding_language.description: The coding level required used in the module.

coding_level.description: The coding level required for the module as a whole.

sequence.description: Groups together modules in a sequence.

sequence_name.description: Name of the sequence as a whole.

relation_type.description: Type of relationship between modules. For a sequence the relation_type should be "sequence".

next_sequential_module.description: Identifier of next module in the sequence.

relationship.description: Relates two or more modules to one another.

this_module.description: Name of the sequence as a whole.
